definition: (TCM) the four methods of diagnosis, namely 望診|望诊[wang4 zhen3] (observation), 聞診|闻诊[wen2 zhen3] (auscultation and olfaction), 問診|问诊[wen4 zhen3] (interrogation), 切診|切诊[qie4 zhen3] (pulse feeling and palpation)
(TCM) diagnosis based on the patient's pulse/to make such a diagnosis
interpretation of the cause/onset and process of an illness/pathogenesis
treatment involving the use of tonics to restore the patient's health/reinforcing method (in acupuncture)
Chinese and Western medicine/a doctor trained in Chinese and Western medicine
disorder of internal organs caused by overexertion
medicinal dietary supplement that helps build up one's health
(TCM) observation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
